poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Seconds away, they kissed and clinched The deal. Hair kinked and crimped, Chan Tartan kilt, a chest of China, Linen, quilt and cutlery. They clinked Glasses clipped by hoboes, no, Bohemians, shied their empties Off a cliff. The worst man quipped about The boxers. Then it clicked: She hadn't quit her job, she'd Kipped on it and got kicked out. So all that flashy kit?
